result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua D. Aldinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: concurrent with 15 CF 240 & 15 CF 278, but consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be determined by the District Attorney within 30 days or deemed waived, any objections to be filed within 10 days of notice of determination.  When (if) restitution is ordered it shall be joint and several with 15 CF 289 (Joshua Barforth).

2/11/16:  Per Amended Motion and Order for Restitution and Surcharge filed 01/22/16, court orders restitution in the amount $12,759.48 plus surcharges on 15CF277.  (Joint & Several with Joshua Barforth - Case # 15CF288 - Tom Luedeke - $3,104.48).

If sentence is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Provide DNA sample.  Take medications as prescribed.  Random urinalysis immediately upon release from custody.
